column1: Why did the cat fall into the well? because he couldnt see that well.
column3: well can mean a deep hole for water, and it can also mean in good health or satisfactorily
column4: The well behind my house is deeper than I expected.
column5: After a week of rest, I am feeling well again.

column1: Did you hear about the fire at the circus? it was in tents.
column3: in can mean within or inside something, and it can also refer to being fashionable or popular
column4: The kids are playing in the yard.
column5: She is really in this seasons latest trends.

column1: What do you call the hair of a centaur? a: humane.
column3: humane means showing compassion or benevolence, while it also plays on human, suggesting a human-like quality
column4: We must treat all animals in a humane manner.
column5: The humane society works tirelessly to protect animals in need.

column1: I didnt really want to go to the seafood buffet... ...but I just went for the halibut.
column3: halibut is a type of fish, while halibut can humorously suggest halibut as a reason to go
column4: Halibut is a popular dish served at many restaurants.
column5: I really enjoy fishing for halibut during the summer months.

column1: Ever heard of the undertaker who accidentally dug another body? he made a grave mistake.
column3: grave refers to a burial place, and it can also mean serious or solemn
column4: The grave was adorned with flowers and tokens of remembrance.
column5: It is a grave situation that requires immediate attention.
